iterations.yara_rule:
rule EvasionPatterns
{
    meta:
        description = "Detects potential evasion techniques through specific instruction sequences involving memory access and calls."
        cape_options = "bp0=$pattern0+0,action0=skip,bp1=$pattern1+0,action1=skip,bp2=$pattern2+0,action2=skip,count=0"
        author = "Security Analyst"
        date = "2023-10-15"

    strings:
        $pattern0 = { 6A ?? 5A 8B CE E8 ?? ?? ?? ?? 85 C0 } // PUSH, POP, MOV ECX, ESP, CALL, TEST EAX
        $pattern1 = { 8B 45 ?? E8 ?? ?? ?? ?? 85 C0 } // MOV EAX, [ESP+??], CALL, TEST EAX
        $pattern2 = { 8B 45 ?? 8B 45 ?? E8 ?? ?? ?? ?? } // Two MOVs from ESP, followed by CALL

    condition:
        any of ($pattern0, $pattern1, $pattern2)
}
improvement_suggestions: Adjust the patterns to account for register-indirect calls and flexible memory references. Use wildcards for addresses and registers to increase match flexibility.
